title: Dragon rider
data:
**Dragon Rider** is a role in [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"). In pre-rework versions of SpliceHack, the role was known as **Dragonmaster**. Dragon riders are competent melee fighters and middling spellcasters. They are most known for their ability to tame [dragons](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon") as most roles would tame domestic animals, and their inability to wear dragon armor. Dragon riders begin the game with a saddled [tame](/wiki/Tame "Tame") [baby dragon](/wiki/Baby_dragon "Baby dragon") as a pet. Only [humans](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)"), [elves](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)"), [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\) "Drow (starting race)"), and changelings can begin the game as Dragon riders.

## Starting inventory

Each Dragon rider starts with the following:

- A +1 [broadsword](/wiki/Broadsword "Broadsword")
- A +1 [scale mail](/wiki/Scale_mail "Scale mail")
- [Gloves](/wiki/Gloves "Gloves")
- [High boots](/wiki/High_boots "High boots")
- A [potion of healing](/wiki/Potion_of_healing "Potion of healing")
- A [lamp](/wiki/Lamp "Lamp")
- A [leash](/wiki/Leash "Leash")
- 2 [food rations](/wiki/Food_ration "Food ration")
- 2 [tripe rations](/wiki/Tripe_ration "Tripe ration")
- 10% chance of a magic marker

## Intrinsics

Dragon riders gain intrinsics at these [experience levels](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level"):

- Level 7: [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed")
- Level 15: [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance")
- Level 16: [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance")
- Level 18: [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance")
- Level 19: [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance")
- Level 21: [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance")
- Level 23: [disintegration resistance](/wiki/Disintegration_resistance "Disintegration resistance")

## Skills

| **Max** | **Skill**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| ------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Basic   | - *Weapons:* [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife"), [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe"), [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe"), [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword"), [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword"), [two-handed sword](/wiki/Two-handed_sword "Two-handed sword"), [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar"), [club](/wiki/Club "Club"), [flail](/wiki/Flail "Flail"), [hammer](/wiki/Hammer "Hammer"), [trident](/wiki/Trident "Trident"), [bow](/wiki/Bow "Bow")
- *Spells:* [attack spells](/wiki/Attack_spells "Attack spells"), [matter spells](/wiki/Matter_spells "Matter spells")
- *Combat:* [power attack](/wiki/Skills_\(SpliceHack\) "Skills (SpliceHack)") |
| Skilled | * *Weapons:* [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber"), [crossbow](/wiki/Crossbow "Crossbow")
* *Combat:* [two-weapon combat](/wiki/Two-weapon_combat "Two-weapon combat"), [disarm](/wiki/Skills_\(SpliceHack\) "Skills (SpliceHack)"), [sunder](/wiki/Skills_\(SpliceHack\) "Skills (SpliceHack)")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Expert  | - *Weapons:* [broadsword](/wiki/Broadsword "Broadsword"), [mace](/wiki/Mace "Mace"), [morning star](/wiki/Morning_star "Morning star"), [polearms](/wiki/Polearms "Polearms"), [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear"), [lance](/wiki/Lance "Lance"), [bare hands](/wiki/Bare_hands "Bare hands")
- *Combat:* [riding](/wiki/Riding "Riding"), [dragon tamer](#class_skill)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |

## Class skill

Dragon Tamer: Allows the user to tame dragons by chatting with them. Additional ranks in dragon tamer increase the chance of success. This skill is unique to the class, so you can only advance it by starting as a Dragon Rider, or gaining 5 levels in the class as a [multiclass](/index.php?title=Multiclass\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Multiclass (page does not exist)") character.

## Pet dragons

Dragon riders begin the game with a tame baby dragon as a pet. This baby dragon is selected randomly from all dragon types except black. Dragon riders gain a number of benefits from their relationship with dragons.

### General

- Dragon riders can tame any dragon as one would tame a domestic animal, with the notable exception of SpliceHack's elder dragons.
- Dragon riders can [ride](/wiki/Ride "Ride") their pet dragons without reducing their tameness.
- Each turn a pet dragon spends adjacent to a Dragon rider, they provide the Dragon rider with one point of passive energy regeneration.

### Assistance

Pet dragons will assist a Dragon rider when adjacent to them in times of need.

- Dragons will free stuck Dragon riders.
- Dragons will nudge sleeping Dragon riders awake.
- [Red dragons](/wiki/Red_dragon "Red dragon") and [baby red dragons](/wiki/Baby_red_dragon "Baby red dragon") will exhale on the Dragon rider to cure them of sliming.

## Restrictions

- Dragon riders are incapable of wearing dragon scales or dragon scale mail.
- Eating a dragon corpse is considered cannibalism.

## Strategy

### Conducts

Due to their preexisting reliance on pets, Dragon riders are a good choice to go for the [pacifist](/wiki/Pacifist "Pacifist") and [weaponless](/wiki/Weaponless "Weaponless") conducts.

### Early game

#### General

Dragon riders excel in the early game. Their pet dragon, although slow, is strong enough to take care of most monsters for them. Dragon riders can afford to hang back and let it do the fighting for them. Optionally, take care when bringing dragons into shops, since they are likely to wreck any shopkeeper who looks at them funny.

#### Objectives

Be on the lookout for anything that can be used to improve [AC](/wiki/AC "AC"). Additionally, finding a [wand of speed monster](/wiki/Wand_of_speed_monster "Wand of speed monster") should be a priority, since one zap transforms their pet from a strong sidekick into a terrifying destructive force. Finally, pick up as many food items as possible in order to be prepared for taming dragons later in the game.

### Mid game

#### General

Dragon riders struggle in the mid game. Their pet becomes much less useful, and their lack of powerful intrinsics and inability to wear dragon armor hurts them. Finding strong items in general can be a struggle. While the Dragon rider quest is not terribly difficult, the reward obtained from it is mediocre. [Sharur](/wiki/Sharur "Sharur") is very weak as far as artifact weapons go, and can usually be invoked immediately for an additional pet.

#### Objectives

Find as many items as possible to increase AC, and enchant your armor. Prioritize items that will grant [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance"), since [gray dragon scale mail](/wiki/Gray_dragon_scale_mail "Gray dragon scale mail") is not an option.

### Late game

If they are adequately prepared, Dragon riders have a strong late game. The increased presence of dragons means that numerous powerful pets are readily available, and those with pet red dragons will be safer from delayed instadeaths via [sliming](/wiki/Sliming "Sliming"). The [Plane of Air](/wiki/Plane_of_Air "Plane of Air") generates with five random dragons spread throughout the level, potentially providing the Dragon rider with pets to take through the planes.

## Quest

The Dragon rider quest sees you fighting [Slipscale the Betrayer](/wiki/Slipscale_the_Betrayer "Slipscale the Betrayer") and his pet white dragon [Voanairruth](/wiki/Voanairruth "Voanairruth") in an attempt to obtain the artifact mace [Sharur](/wiki/Sharur "Sharur").
